result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca J Rodz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca J Rodz in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Rebecca J Rodz.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for doctor's report return. Defendant does not agree to doctor's report; defense requested motion hearing. Bail/bond hearing proceeded. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defendant's motion to modify bail. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 36. Motion hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
RODZ Competency Report.  Received and Filed.  nk
Received and Filed. Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant Rebecca J Rodz in court with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Defendant Rebecca J Rodz in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Rebecca J Rodz appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Rebecca J Rodz not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with KSB; CJF; White's Trailer Park (incident location) at 5926 South Packard Avenue. Cudahy, WI. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Rebecca J Rodz in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appearing by phone via Zoom.  Defendant Rebecca J Rodz in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rebecca J Rodz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
